title: Smoked Salmon & Dill Scramble
description: A silky, herb-fresh scrambled egg dish folded with delicate smoked salmon and bright dill. Quick to make for breakfast or brunch, finished with cream for extra richness and lemon for lift.

ingredients.display_name: smoked salmon, sliced or torn into pieces

ingredients.notes: divided (half for cooking, half for finishing)
adds richness; can reduce for lighter version
add sparingly because smoked salmon is salty

ingredients.display_name: extra-virgin olive oil (for toast or pan if preferred)
ingredients.notes: optional, for toasting bread or nonstick pan

ingredients.display_name: toasted bread or bagels, to serve

steps.text: Prep ingredients: crack eggs into a bowl and whisk gently with cream until just combined; fold in half the chopped dill, a pinch of salt and black pepper; tear smoked salmon into bite-sized pieces; slice chives and measure butter and lemon.
Preheat a nonstick skillet over low-medium heat; add half the butter and let it melt until foaming but not browning to create a gentle cooking fat.
Pour the egg mixture into the warm pan and let it sit without stirring for about 10-15 seconds to start setting at the edges.

Using a silicone spatula, gently push the set edges toward the center and tilt the pan to let uncooked egg flow; repeat in gentle folds to form large, soft curds. Keep the heat low to avoid overcooking.

When eggs are mostly set but still slightly glossy (just undercooked), fold in the smoked salmon pieces and remaining butter; continue folding for a few more seconds until eggs finish cooking and salmon is warmed through but not broken down.
Remove pan from heat, finish with lemon juice, remaining fresh dill and chives; adjust seasoning carefully and add capers if using. Let residual heat finish the eggs for a creamy texture.
Serve immediately on toasted bread or bagels, or plated with a simple green salad. Garnish with extra dill, cracked pepper, and a light drizzle of olive oil if desired.
